reviews.review_msg: All around awesome guy and he truly cares about your learning.

He's a great lecturer. He's well-spoken, interactive, and clear during lectures. Attendance gets recorded in tutorials. He emphasizes participation and takes record of whether you contributed to lecture discussions.
Really good professor, knows what he is talking about.

His course is very structured and you know what to expect. His lectures are suitable for any class level & size and his way of speaking was neither too intensive or unengaging. From what I know, he previously taught higher-level courses and electives but I see he's more than capable of handling required lower-division courses, which is not easy.

Kam is great. As the creator of 275, he did a great job, and he does a great job teaching it. You can tell he is very passionate about the material. The course is very structured, and you know what to expect from assignments/quizzes/exams. He also provides a lot of help, as do the TA's. To excel, understand/memorize the concepts, and read.

This professor is great, and he is new to the Beedie; he doesn't give any breaks in the class, and all the course is talking about Indigenous people and how to protect the environment (without any content with business). But overall, he is the good choice for this course.

This prof was great! She brought in guest speakers and stayed after to help. Curved courses are difficult regardless of the content but the prof made it it easy to comprehend. If you study and go to class you can succeed pretty easily in this course.

This professor was fantastic! This class is curved, so she will likely receive some negative feedback from students who received poor grades. She was a great professor and was very open to helping students after class and during office hours. Highly recommend taking future courses with this professor!

This professor was fantastic. In a new age of pressing climate risks, learning about them in a business context is valuable. The Beedie department determined that this course is necessary for valid reasons. If you showed up and tried, it was a very straightforward class. The professor herself was delightful, staying after class to help students.
This course is a waste of time and money. This course is taught from a one-sided perspective.

Idk what y'all are on, but Emily's a GEM. Best prof so far, hands down. She actually cares ü´∂ she ain't just here for the paycheck. Content was easy, exam was decent, and she stayed after to help ‚Äî who even does that? You gotta show up for quizzes though, and group projects can ruin your soul. Class could be more organized, but I LOVE THIS GAL.

This professor was great; she related class concepts to a lot of local ongoing problems, which resonated with me and helped me learn. She was available for extra help when I asked and continuously stayed to help students understand concepts better. The class was engaging and the instruction was excellent!

Interesting and easy course and good professor. She brought guest speakers for some lectures which was awesome. Attendance is mandatory for lectures for readiness tests, and for tutorial for participation marks.

I am quite surprised by the poor ratings for this semester. This professor was fantastic and used relevant examples to explain important topics in business sustainability. The assignments were explained thoroughly, and she was available for questions if you just asked her. No complaints, one of the better courses offered in Beedie, taught well.
TAs are tough graders with assignments and never provide feedback on areas to improve. the curve is very high so this class is not a grade booster. do not take unless required!

This class is absolutely useless and is not a grade booster since the curve is so high. Vague instructions and criteria/rubrics given for assignments makes it hard to follow through with what is expected. weekly quizzes are super annoying and the reading prep materials are a snooze fest.
Doesn't give any feedback on assignments, gives vague instructions. The only reason I knew what was going on was because of the TA, who was fantastic. Disgraceful professor, absolutely shocking.
Such a fun teacher!
Super nice teacher.
Amazing professor. She us really caring and supportive

Emily is a great professor who deeply cares about the topics she teaches. She will make time for you if you want concepts explained further. She encourages participation in her class but recognizes that not everyone likes to raise their hand, so she offers optional online discussions to participate instead. I'd recommend taking this class!
Good prof, hella nice, easy and just chill. Only thing is that this class requires attendance as you needa take quizzes every class basically which is the only annoying thing.
A little bit messy. However, very caring.

An amazing and kind professor who always cares about the students and how they can genuinely succeed. You can tell that she is passionate about sustainability and how a little kindness can go a long way in the business world.

Sara was a very nice prof who obviously cares about her students and loves what she teaches.  However, this class was incredibly disorganized.  Lot of work covering very little material.  Projects and assignments focused on re-hashing the same materials in a different way.  The class started off interesting but felt like a chore nearing the end.

I'm taking 303 with Prof. Graves after taking 275 with her last term. In a classroom of ~200 1st and 2nd years who don't want to do much of anything unless it's complain (hey, I was one of them less than a year ago!), she always impressed. Somehow brilliant, kind and beautiful inside and out. Easily of the most inspiring profs at Beedie.

Possibly the worst prof I've ever had at sfu. Very disorganized and gave unclear instructions for everything. The midterm was a MESS and we never received the marks for the final project. I can tell she is a nice person but she is not a good teacher. I would not recommend.
unstapled midterm packages is all I have to say...

One of the most supportive professors I've had in any class thus far. She is easily accessible outside of class and proactive to ensure we understand concepts during class. Classes are engaging and no student should have trouble answering questions if they do the pre-readings. Start early with assigned readings and you'll enjoy the class.

I don't pay attention, there are bi-weekly tests on readings which are pretty difficult...but only worth 10% of mark so don't worry. Midterm average was 70% so it wasn't even bad, refer to the lec and tut slides, not so much of the readings for the midterm. NO final exam in this class. I got a good group and did good on the midterm (worth 30%).

She's nice but unorganized and low-tech. The course is kinda useless, and not worth 3 credits. Everything we learned is about the articles online. Too much reading and the exam, quizzes based on the online articles. Nothing specific, SFU should make the course better if they want it to be a mandatory course.

Professor is rich with their ideology and poor with their execution. Many articles and podcasts. VERY Unclear grading criteria. Gave a 2 hour class for explaining midterm which was nice of her to do, yet it was all a lie and the midterm was NOTHING as told. If SFU was going to make this a mandatory class to take, they could have done better.
Super low tech, unorganized

This is the worst professor I've had so far. Class starts consistently 10-15mins late everyday, she gives us hours of articles and podcasts to go through during the week only to completely change what was required a day before the lecture, our midterm started an hour late. This website does not give enough space to talk about how bad she is.
The worst teacher ever. she is very disorganized and always late to the class. She changed the whole exam at the last minutes.

Studying about sustainability gave me a great insight about a circular lifeycle! The concepts learned in the material were applied when 100 misprinted midterms had an unforunate end of life in the dumpster. A good amount of reading and podcasts, but at least shes a rocket to make up for it ;)

Talks so much about sustainability but had to print an extra 200 copies of the exam because the first 200 had the answers on them. She was also late already to the exam and took more time to print the exams. Thankful that she reduced the questions tho. Her classes are also very unstructured and she goes off topic a ton. Thank god for my TA.
Awful prof. Came 45 min late to our midterm. She also always come lates to class and is not teaching anything.

20 pages of reading and 1 hour podcasts due every week and quizzes on the material every 2 weeks.  Slides are unorganized and text heavy. Lectures are not engaging and difficult to get through. The professors attitude towards students makes it very difficult to ask questions and makes the environment feel hostile. Do not recommend.

Avoid at all costs!!!!!!!! Her tutorial group said to us don't need to take this course seriously but this course required us to read 30+ page articles and listen to podcasts every week. She is so unorganized and her grading is super vague. I can't handle this anymore. Help me get out of this class ASAP!!!

A lot of homework, have to read so many pdf and article, also have to listen to podcasts everyweek for quizzes. however, she change the reading material in the last minute without any notification. the lecture is so boring, her voice is really hard to listen, speaks too fast, no one can understand what she said. she didnt post the lecture on time

Her grading is so vague. You have to attend tutorials weekly for participation marks. She doesn't know how to teach but she is approachable for any questions. The tutorials do help but the course itself is so ambiguous. Just avoid her, she speaks so fast that it's difficult to keep up with what she says. This class is created to steal student money

Sara truly cares about her students and tries to make sure that everyone is in a safe space to be able to share, connect with each other, and be in a good mental head space. Her lectures are super interesting and she has a wealth of knowledge to share. She encourages the students to dive deeper into the material and get a greater understanding.

She gives off a very ‚Äúunsure of what I'm doing‚Äù vibe with a trembling voice and lack of structure in her dialogue despite seemingly having a lot of experience in her profession. Mandatory in class quizzes so you kind of need to go. Also does not help that she is mic popping every other sentence.
I could say, Listen carefully for the lectures, then you would be fine for the exams.
